what: Data from the Welham et al (2015) Statistical Methods in Biology
title: Data from the Welham et al (2015) Statistical Methods in Biology
text: package provides data book Welham et al. (2015) “Statistical Methods Biology” added acknowledgement permission Sue Welham.

title: Data from the Welham et al (2015) Statistical Methods in Biology
text: can install development version smbdata like :

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: Measurements air temperature (°C) made approximately 9 .m. 100 days 2006 standard glass mercury dry bulb thermometer new electronic dry bulb thermistor probe.

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: data frame 100 rows 4 variables: Unit unit number. DayNo Day number. Mercury, Thermistor Temperature (°C) measured standard glass mercury thermometer new electronic thermometer.

title: Air temperature — airtemp
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Aphids — aphids
text: ecological survey done investigate co-occurrence various insect predator prey species. , consider subset data relating one aphid species, pea aphid, Acyrthosiphon pisum. three fields, 15 randomly chosen triplets adjacent bean plants inspected number pea aphids present three plants recorded.

title: Aphids — aphids
text: data frame 45 rows 4 variables: ID, Field, Sample, AphidCount. ID ID number. Field field number. Sample sample number. AphidCount count aphids.

title: Aphids — aphids
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Beetles — beetles
text: experiment conducted investigate viability interspecies mating leaf beetles examination results females two species willow beetle (brassy willow beetle, Phratora vitellinae, blue willow beetle, Phratora vulgatissima) mated males either species (intraspecies mating) species (interspecies mating), .e. four treatments total (details, see Peacock et al., 2004). experiment carried CRD (completely randomized design) 10 replicates treatment.

title: Beetles — beetles
text: data frame 5 variables: DFemale, Treatment, Species, MateType, Eggs. DFemale ID number. Treatment treatment level. Species Species. MateType Mating type: intraspecies interspecies mating. Eggs number eggs. #' @source Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: experiment done investigate effects changing procedure processing samples obtain measurements carbon soil microbial biomass (mg C per kg soil). protocol examination used 200 g soil samples passed 2.5 mm sieve shaken 60 min. experiment tested effects larger sieve, two smaller sample weights reduced shaking time, giving 2 × 3 × 2 factorial structure. 12 treatment combinations replicated four times CRD. aim analysis quantify effects individual modifications, whether interact, evaluate whether modified procedures obtain results within 10

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: data frame 5 variables: DSample, Size, Weight, Time, C.

title: Measuring soil microbial biomass — biomassc
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: experiment done screen set fungal isolates pathogenicity seedlings oilseed rape. isolates collected two different species Brassica, labelled B factor Species, several different isolates species tested (nine group four group B), labelled factor Isolate (nine levels). experiment run three replicates across time (factor Rep), tray 22 (replicate 2) 23 seedlings (replicates 1 3) tested isolate run (factor Tray, 13 levels). number seedlings tested stored variate Seedlings. number resistant seedlings, .e. showing signs infection (variate Resistant), recorded five days isolates applied.

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: data frame 9 variables: ID, Rep, Tray, Species, Isolate, TypeA, TypeB, Seedlings, Resistant.

title: Sreening for pathogenicity — brassica
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: experiment devised evaluate effect four relative concentrations (levels) calcium (= 1, B = 5, C = 10, D = 20) root growth. treatment applied five individual plants growing pots. experiment used CRD, shown Table 3.2, measurements total root length (cm) made pots 1–20 (order) end experiment.

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: data frame 3 variables: Pot, Calcium, Length.

title: Calcium pot trial — calcium
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Another calcium pot trial — calcium2
text: Consider pot trial data Examples 3.4 4.1. Four relative concentrations calcium (= 1, B = 5, C = 10, D = 20) applied five individual plants growing pots arranged CRD. end experiment, total root length (cm) 20 pots measured.

title: Another calcium pot trial — calcium2
text: data frame 7 variables: Pot, Calcium, Length, d1, d2, d3, d4.

title: Another calcium pot trial — calcium2
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: ELISA calibration — calibrate
text: calibration experiment done establish suitable protocol experimental procedure. Three methods preparation (factor Prep) tested combination four different initial concentrations (factor Conc), two replicates combination. solutions applied randomized order ELISA plate processed.

title: ELISA calibration — calibrate
text: data frame 4 variables: Unit, Prep, Conc, Absorbance.

title: ELISA calibration — calibrate
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Weed competition experiment — competition
text: field experiment investigate effect weed competitors yield winter wheat set RCBD three blocks 18 plots. Three weed species used: chickweed (CW), black-grass (BG) cleavers (CL). Target weed densities 0, 40, 80, 160, 320 640 plants per m2 CW BG, 0, 3, 6, 12, 24 48 plants per m2 CL. However, weed densities achieved lower differed among species.

title: Weed competition experiment — competition
text: data frame 7 variables: ID, Block, WholePlot, Subplot, Irrigation, Species, Grain.

title: Weed competition experiment — competition
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Weed competition experiment — competition
code: library(desplot) #> Error in library(desplot): there is no package called ‘desplot’ desplot(Irrigation ~ WholePlot + Subplot | Block, data=competition, col=Species, cex=2) #> Error in desplot(Irrigation ~ WholePlot + Subplot | Block, data = competition,     col = Species, cex = 2): could not find function "desplot" summary(aov(Grain ~ Species*Irrigation + Error(Block/WholePlot/Subplot), data=competition)) #>  #> Error: Block #>           Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) #> Residuals  1  1.429   1.429                #>  #> Error: Block:WholePlot #>            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq #> Irrigation  1  1.704   1.704 #>  #> Error: Block:WholePlot:Subplot #>         Df Sum Sq Mean Sq #> Species  1  7.835   7.835 #>  #> Error: Within #>                    Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)     #> Species             3  79.04  26.347  54.357 4.52e-10 *** #> Irrigation          1  16.64  16.640  34.331 8.14e-06 *** #> Species:Irrigation  3   3.55   1.183   2.441   0.0927 .   #> Residuals          21  10.18   0.485                      #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Conidial release experiment — conidia
text: experiment set primary aim measuring aphid infection rates response differing doses fungus. Aphids inoculation chambers subjected conidia showers sporulating cadavers one two different sources (clone standard source) one eight time periods ranging 0 80 min. Estimates conidial doses received aphids obtained counts spores slides placed chambers. , investigate relationship achieved dose (variate Conidia) infection time (variate Time) two types source (factor Source). time period source combination tested two experimental runs (factor Run). Separate sources used replicate time period.

title: Conidial release experiment — conidia
text: data frame 7 variables: ID, Run, DUnit, Source, Time, Period, Conidia.

title: Conidial release experiment — conidia
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

what: Cotton response to herbicide and insecticide — cotton
title: Cotton response to herbicide and insecticide — cotton
text: experiment done evaluate combined effects five different doses herbicide (0, 20, 40, 60 80 lb/acre) five different doses insecticide (0.0, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5 2.0 lb/acre) root growth cotton plants containers within glasshouse. Four replicates treatment combination arranged CRD. three weeks, dry root biomass (g/plant) measured container.

title: Cotton response to herbicide and insecticide — cotton
Cotton response to herbicide and insecticide — cotton
text: data frame 4 variables: ID, H, , Weight.

title: Cotton response to herbicide and insecticide — cotton
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Genetics of root growth — cross
text: experiment conducted investigate genetic component root growth manipulated lines. Two male parents (factor Male, levels M1 M2) crossed five female parents (factor Female, levels F1–F5) eight seeds grown cross CRD. Root growth (maximum length) measured (mm) three weeks (variate Root). Unfortunately, many seeds viable genetic incompatibilities, leading reduced replication treatments 30 observations total.

title: Genetics of root growth — cross
text: data frame 4 variables: Seed, Female, Male, Root.

title: Genetics of root growth — cross
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

what: Effect of type and size of cutting on willow yield — cuttings
title: Effect of type and size of cutting on willow yield — cuttings
text: field experiment designed investigate whether type cutting planted affects subsequent growth willows. Cuttings five different types (–E, factor Type) planted, growth parameters measured following seasons, including yield end first year. planting time, realized cuttings planted varied greatly size, might also effect subsequent growth. Two options considered . Cutting size confounded blocks, block contained cuttings one size . Alternatively, cutting size investigated extraneous factor, addition type. second option taken, cuttings classified small (S), medium (M) large (L, factor Size). type × size combinations available, total number plots fixed 25. design based five-block RCBD respect cutting type, different sizes allocated balanced way possible across blocks (factor Block) cutting types. yield (variate Yield) allocation size type combinations five blocks.

title: Effect of type and size of cutting on willow yield — cuttings
Effect of type and size of cutting on willow yield — cuttings
text: data frame 6 variables: ID, Block, Plot, Type, Size, Yield.

title: Effect of type and size of cutting on willow yield — cuttings
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression

title: Demethylation experiment — demethylation
text: experiment pilot study intended calibrate scientific procedure. demethylation agent applied plants: agent effect converting methylated nucleotides non-methylated form, causing epigenetic changes lead abnormal phenotypes stunting deformation (Amoah et al., 2008). pilot study aimed investigate relationship dose resulting proportion plants normal phenotype. Seed treated demethylation agent six doses, including zero control dose. Plants grown trays, tray sown seeds treated dose agent dose replicated four trays: two 60 plants, two 100 plants. trays arranged CRD.

title: Demethylation experiment — demethylation
text: data frame 4 variables: DTray, Dose, Total, Normal.

title: Demethylation experiment — demethylation
text: Welham, S. J., Gezan, S. ., Clark, S. J., Mead, . (2015) Statistical Methods Biology: Design analysis experiments regression
